  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client​(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      This is the intermediary between Server and the Client. Here we receive input from Server, converting it in order to show to the User's GUI

      Here are implemented methods to write and read from Socket

      Parameters:
      ip - Ip of the Server we want to connect to
      port - Port on which the Client and Server will speak
      See Also:
      Server

  • Method Details

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns:
      true if active, false otherwise

    • setActive

      public void setActive​(boolean active)
      Parameters:
      active - true to set active, false otherwise

    • asyncReadFromSocket

      public java.lang.Thread asyncReadFromSocket​(java.io.ObjectInputStream socketIn)
      A dedicated thread created to receive Objects from the Server

      Simply print in the Standard Output, if socketIn is a String

      Call the Board Draw method, to show changes in Board, if socketIn is a Board

      If an execption occur this thread will be killed

      Parameters:
      socketIn - An ObjectInputStream to receive from the Socket
      Returns:
      New thread waiting for input from the Server
      See Also:
      Board

    • asyncWriteToSocket

      public java.lang.Thread asyncWriteToSocket​(java.util.Scanner stdin, java.io.PrintWriter socketOut)
      A dedicated thread created to receive Strings from CLI. This is flushed when a \n character is found
      Parameters:
      stdin - Input received from Standard Input( User keyboard) in CLI
      socketOut - a PrintWriter, where the Input received from CLI will be send
      Returns:
      New thread waiting for input from the CLI

    • run

      public void run() throws java.io.IOException
      The main thread associated to the Client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Should be never used, since Threads that read or write to Socket are killed if an exception occurs
      See Also:
      asyncReadFromSocket(ObjectInputStream), asyncWriteToSocket(Scanner, PrintWriter)
